inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: standard infertility evaluation and a candidate for intrauterine insemination

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: attest to safe sex practices, know the HIV-status of their partner, be informed of risks of this procedure and alternatives

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: been referred or self-refer to Dr. Schust for infertility treatment

inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: <50,000 copies/mL and CD4 count > 250 cells/mL for the preceding 6 month period

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: disease must be under control without evidence of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS)

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: have semen quality adequate for intrauterine insemination

notes: The patient is a 55-year-old man who was recently diagnosed with Parkinson's disease. He has mild symptoms and is being treated with Levodopa and Trihexyphenidyl.
